posts.title: CIA director says US has paused intelligence support to Ukraine
top_comments:
>In the lead up to Trump’s inauguration, Ratcliffe and the Trump transition team were told of the value of intelligence sharing with Ukraine by US officials who stressed that it was a hallmark of their achievements on the battlefield, according to a source familiar with the discussions.

Well, that's something, isn't it.
The whole world is about to shift away from America and conservatives are going to wonder what happened in a decade.
Just in case anyone believed that it was ever actually about the money and not an ideological desire to support Russia in the war.
Sooner or later the US will share their intelligence support to its new closest ally: Russia.
Intelligence in the United States has been paused as well.
If not Russian asset, why Russian asset shaped?

Better headline:  
\> Russian Agent has paused US intelligence sharing with Ukraine
They've paused intelligence alright
we are the baddies, its official
There won't be future support from the US to Ukraine at all. It's over. Trump is going to start a manufactured fight with the entire EU I imagine to use it as a pretense to leave NATO and The UN.

posts.title: Supreme Court rejects Trump’s request to keep billions in foreign aid frozen
top_comments:
Alito’s dissent is some choice bullshit. “How dare a lower court override the president!”

The lower court found that congress had specified money to be spent, and the executive branch can’t just say “Nah.” They can slow walk it, they can do some other shady shit - but in the end they gotta pay out that money. 

Alito’s so concerned about someone overturning the president he’s saying the statutes congress passed don’t matter.

It’s kind of mind boggling that 4 Supreme Court Justices support the idea that the Executive branch can just deicide not to pay their bills when the Legislative branch has allocated the funding and the recipients have already done what they were to be paid to do.
OK, so now let’s see if trump complies and if he doesn’t, then what?

That there are only five SCOTUS votes for paying congressionally mandated invoices for work *already* done!? This should be as basic a test of Article I as you can get. And that does not bode well for decisions to come
Damn Justice Amy Coney Barrett doing justice.

Interesting that 2 conservatives, including 1 Trump appointee in Barrett ruled against Trump. Though maybe not so much considering how relatively extreme this case is. The decision to spend this money is made by Congress and the executive branch, in theory, shouldn't be able to stop it for long.

What will be more interesting(albeit also scary and dangerous) is what happens if the executive branch starts to ignore judicial rulings that they don't like.

If Congress sits around and concedes authority to the executive branch and the judicial branch turns out to be toothless, that kind of defeats the whole checks and balances concept that we've leaned on for so long. From there the executive can do whatever, no?
Hallelujah. I haven’t been keeping up too much with which justices vote for what so maybe this is normal, but I was surprised to see Amy Coney Barrett voted with the liberal justices.

“Four of the court’s conservatives — Justices Clarence Thomas, Samuel Alito, Neil Gorsuch and Brett Kavanaugh — dissented.”

These are the men who will dismantle our democracy. 

So shocked by Coney Barrett. I guess he does understand the Constitution and the benefit of rule of law. 

BTW- this ruling merely states that the USG must pay for work already done by implementers. This is money owed to them.

So, it looks like this isn't a particularly strong ruling against Trump, despite the headline, given that it basically shifts responsibility back down to the lower court.

At least that's something, I guess?

In any case, we'll see if Trump decides to Jackson this.
Whenever I hear even moderately good news from SCOTUS, I immediately fear that it's a bone being thrown to the Left right before an awful ruling for Trump.

posts.title: Piglets left to starve as part of a controversial art exhibition in Denmark have been stolen
top_comments: This the same artist that did the goldfish in blenders?

Good on the activists who stole them and the guy who helped. This artist is nuts. What an awful person.

 This just seems extra cruel for no real end game, like its not going to stop anyone from anything, it was suffering for the sake of "art".
This is not art it’s animal cruelty

> Chilean-born Marco Evaristti said he had been aiming to raise awareness of the suffering caused by mass meat production with his art installation that opened last week in Copenhagen. The piglets were being denied food and water and would have been allowed to starve to death.

I don't think the way to advocate against animal cruelty, is to cause more animal cruelty. Especially when you're subjecting a creature to a slow death that is initially pretty agonizing.

There was an artist a while back who did something like this with a dog. Guillermo Vargas brought in a starving street dog from outside and had it in the art gallery for 3 hours - the gallery reported that he did feed it food and water while it was there, before it "escaped." Guests were shocked and complained about it, and the artist's point was basically, it's the same dog you walked past outside but didn't give a shit about.
Suffering for his art is probably a good thing. Replace the missing pigs in the cage with the artist - maybe it will make the same point.
I’m inclined to think this artist is actually a psychopath.  Performing animal cruelty to point out other people’s cruelty is certainly a choice.

Maybe, just maybe, the theft of the piglets is all part of the art exhibition. I’m not sure this is the case given that the exhibition opened last week. 

If the intention was to allow three piglets to die from thirst there is a special place in hell for the artist. 

“Chilean-born Marco Evaristti said he had been aiming to raise awareness of the suffering caused by mass meat production with his art installation that opened last week in Copenhagen. The piglets were being denied food and water and would have been allowed to starve to death.”

They wouldn’t have starved to death, they would have died of thirst.

I'm going out on a limb here and braving the wall of downvotes.


The provocation artist achived what he wanted without harming the piglets. They were never starved, they were not even showcased.


Yet he managed to upset so many people, that it sparked an outrage highlighting the fact most people don't give two shits about animals dying, as long as they are out of sight. What can be more artful than getting people to reflect on issues they normally wouldn't?


The comments in this post are beyond disappointing and shows they have no grasp on art at all.
What kind of backwards ass thinking is "I have to commit the same abuse in trying to protest".

Did you like the Great Depression? Well, good news, it's back! We've got isolationism! We've got protectionism! We've got the rise of fascism! All the greatest hits!
Won't a flood of applicants drive down wages

posts.title: Los Angeles County sues Southern California Edison, alleging utility’s equipment sparked wildfire
top_comments: Does it make a difference? They'll just pay for the fines by CPUC approved rate hikes.

again. 

This time there appears to be footage as it started.

Same with the fires caused by PG&E.  Newsom screwed the pooch on that one.  California should not only own PG&E, they should make all utilities public entities - including cell companies.  T-Mobile was sued by CPUC for causing large wildfires because of brush around base stations knocking up against the wires and transformers. Just one more example.
They need to prohibit Edison from raising rates post-lawsuit, otherwise it's just going to be Edison customers footing the bill.
17 people died..and thousands of properties were destroyed. Fuck..

*The complaint alleges that witnesses, photos, and videos indicate the fire started directly under Edison transmission lines in Eaton Canyon.    “We are committed to seeking justice for the Altadena community and the taxpayers of Los Angeles County,” she said.*

Sounds like a repeat of the PG&E responsibility for most or many of the northern CA fires, some of which destroyed whole villages and cities.

everyone was ready to hunt down every homeless person and completely change the political landscape when the fire starter was unknown, but the moment we learned the Eaton fire came from a faulty powerline, that lets be real, they probably knew about, all ire just sort of disappeared. 

Utilities like these need to be government owned.

That utility and other companies should be held accountable for the damage they created only makes sense. The problem with suing them doesn't accomplish much. What will happen is they raise rates for their customers. The customer, not the business, will pay the fine, plus higher rates past when it's paid for.

This isn't the first time this has happened. Sure, they take a short-term hit, but they'll get that money back and then some. Maybe jail time for CEOs, managers, or the board of directors. But just fining them millions will only shift the burden to the customers/tax payers.
PG&E just happy they didn’t start another disaster
Alleged? There is video. However, the lawsuit will fail.

posts.title: U.S. Imposes Visa Restrictions on Foreign Officials and Others Facilitating Illegal Migration to the U.S.
Treating male partners along with women may help stop bacterial vaginosis
top_comments:
>For many women who develop bacterial vaginosis, the syndrome returns weeks or months after treatment. A clinical trial of women in monogamous relationships with male partners found that [treating both partners significantly reduced the likelihood of recurrence](https://dx.doi.org/10.1056/NEJMoa2405404), researchers report in the March 5 *New England Journal of Medicine*. When both partners were treated, 35 percent of the women developed bacterial vaginosis again, while in the women-only treatment group, it was 63 percent.

>The treatment approach builds on past research finding that sexual transmission may account for some repeat episodes of bacterial vaginosis. In the new trial, women received the standard treatment: either an oral antibiotic or an intravaginal antibiotic cream or gel. In the group in which both partners were treated, the male partner took the oral antibiotic and applied an antibiotic cream to the skin of the penis for seven days. In the women-only treatment group, 43 out of 68 developed bacterial vaginosis again within 12 weeks, while only 24 out of 69 did when both partners received treatment.

[Read more here.](https://www.sciencenews.org/article/bacterial-vaginosis-treatment-women-men)

Why are the comments here about men being gross?


The article talks about "male partner took the oral antibiotic and applied an antibiotic cream to the skin of the penis for seven days", makes absolutely no mention of hygiene habits being either cause or solution. Just bacteria and antibiotics same as the female partner.
Let’s save this article and link it to those women who complain about their yeast infections because their partner refuses to shower before they’re intimate.
What’s bacterial vaginitis
I was taught in the 80's to treat the male partner. This is far from new
So... Dudes are nasty and need to wash their dick more often, is what I got from this.

posts.title: NYS Corrections enters its third weeks of wildcat strikes; more than 8000 COs still on strike
top_comments:
Hard for me to sympathize with them when one of their major concerns is being limited on how much and often they can use solitary confinement on prisoners.


When a CO is describing being unable to lock people in solitary 24/7 as an “Inhumane condition“ for them to be working under, without a hint of irony that solitary confinement is actually inhumane, they lost me. 


Hire wages, better hours, better prisoner to guard ratios, are all reasonable. Strike to hell and back for those, but “it’s inhumane to not let me be inhumane” is a joke.
So if the CO’s are strike, who’s running the prison? Oh the same people that have always been running a prison. Inmates.
The incarcerated must be overjoyed by being free from sex abuse and violence.

posts.title: FIRE files federal lawsuit against top Texas A&M administrators
top_comments:
>The lawsuit comes days after the Board of Regents banned on-campus drag shows across the 11 universities in the A&M System, including the flagship campus in College Station. The resolution, passed unanimously by the regents last Friday, said drag shows were “inconsistent with the system’s mission and core values of its universities, including the value of respect for others.” 

Really wish they would elaborate more on how drag shows *specifically* violate their "mission and core values". Really seems not that different than theater, musicals, etc which is historically filled with dressing up as the opposite gender. It's all in good fun, so what's the problem?

“The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, or FIRE, has filed a federal lawsuit against the nine members of the Board of Regents, Chancellor John Sharp and Texas A&M President Mark A. Welsh III on behalf of the Queer Empowerment Council, the student organization that hosts and organizes Draggieland.”

Keep the lawsuits coming. Freedom of speech, freedom from persecution and discrimination are the building blocks of our democracy.

What ever happened to just not attending if you're not interested? I mean, it's not the sort of thing I'd go out of my way to see, but I can always just... you know... not attend. When I was in college there would occasionally be some wandering preacher guy who'd show up on campus for a couple days. I wasn't really interested in his message, so I just kept walking. A very simple and elegant solution that didn't involve me trying to impose my personal beliefs on anyone else. I just would have appreciated someone from the campus security doing a bit of crowd control since people listening would often block the entire sidewalk which was a major thoroughfare.

And honestly, nothing beats the name of a SF group: The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence

Well, that's something, isn't it.

If not Russian asset, why Russian asset shaped?

posts.title: Supreme Court rejects Trump’s request to keep billions in foreign aid frozen
top_comments:
Alito’s dissent is some choice bullshit. “How dare a lower court override the president!”

The lower court found that congress had specified money to be spent, and the executive branch can’t just say “Nah.” They can slow walk it, they can do some other shady shit - but in the end they gotta pay out that money. 

Alito’s so concerned about someone overturning the president he’s saying the statutes congress passed don’t matter.

It’s kind of mind boggling that 4 Supreme Court Justices support the idea that the Executive branch can just deicide not to pay their bills when the Legislative branch has allocated the funding and the recipients have already done what they were to be paid to do.
OK, so now let’s see if trump complies and if he doesn’t, then what?

That there are only five SCOTUS votes for paying congressionally mandated invoices for work *already* done!? This should be as basic a test of Article I as you can get. And that does not bode well for decisions to come
Damn Justice Amy Coney Barrett doing justice.

Interesting that 2 conservatives, including 1 Trump appointee in Barrett ruled against Trump. Though maybe not so much considering how relatively extreme this case is. The decision to spend this money is made by Congress and the executive branch, in theory, shouldn't be able to stop it for long.

What will be more interesting(albeit also scary and dangerous) is what happens if the executive branch starts to ignore judicial rulings that they don't like.

If Congress sits around and concedes authority to the executive branch and the judicial branch turns out to be toothless, that kind of defeats the whole checks and balances concept that we've leaned on for so long. From there the executive can do whatever, no?
Hallelujah. I haven’t been keeping up too much with which justices vote for what so maybe this is normal, but I was surprised to see Amy Coney Barrett voted with the liberal justices.

“Four of the court’s conservatives — Justices Clarence Thomas, Samuel Alito, Neil Gorsuch and Brett Kavanaugh — dissented.”

These are the men who will dismantle our democracy. 

So shocked by Coney Barrett. I guess he does understand the Constitution and the benefit of rule of law. 

BTW- this ruling merely states that the USG must pay for work already done by implementers. This is money owed to them.

So, it looks like this isn't a particularly strong ruling against Trump, despite the headline, given that it basically shifts responsibility back down to the lower court.

At least that's something, I guess?

In any case, we'll see if Trump decides to Jackson this.
Whenever I hear even moderately good news from SCOTUS, I immediately fear that it's a bone being thrown to the Left right before an awful ruling for Trump.

posts.title: Piglets left to starve as part of a controversial art exhibition in Denmark have been stolen
top_comments: This the same artist that did the goldfish in blenders?

Good on the activists who stole them and the guy who helped. This artist is nuts. What an awful person.

 This just seems extra cruel for no real end game, like its not going to stop anyone from anything, it was suffering for the sake of "art".
This is not art it’s animal cruelty

> Chilean-born Marco Evaristti said he had been aiming to raise awareness of the suffering caused by mass meat production with his art installation that opened last week in Copenhagen. The piglets were being denied food and water and would have been allowed to starve to death.

I don't think the way to advocate against animal cruelty, is to cause more animal cruelty. Especially when you're subjecting a creature to a slow death that is initially pretty agonizing.

There was an artist a while back who did something like this with a dog. Guillermo Vargas brought in a starving street dog from outside and had it in the art gallery for 3 hours - the gallery reported that he did feed it food and water while it was there, before it "escaped." Guests were shocked and complained about it, and the artist's point was basically, it's the same dog you walked past outside but didn't give a shit about.
Suffering for his art is probably a good thing. Replace the missing pigs in the cage with the artist - maybe it will make the same point.
I’m inclined to think this artist is actually a psychopath.  Performing animal cruelty to point out other people’s cruelty is certainly a choice.

Maybe, just maybe, the theft of the piglets is all part of the art exhibition. I’m not sure this is the case given that the exhibition opened last week. 

If the intention was to allow three piglets to die from thirst there is a special place in hell for the artist. 

“Chilean-born Marco Evaristti said he had been aiming to raise awareness of the suffering caused by mass meat production with his art installation that opened last week in Copenhagen. The piglets were being denied food and water and would have been allowed to starve to death.”

They wouldn’t have starved to death, they would have died of thirst.

I'm going out on a limb here and braving the wall of downvotes.


The provocation artist achived what he wanted without harming the piglets. They were never starved, they were not even showcased.


Yet he managed to upset so many people, that it sparked an outrage highlighting the fact most people don't give two shits about animals dying, as long as they are out of sight. What can be more artful than getting people to reflect on issues they normally wouldn't?


The comments in this post are beyond disappointing and shows they have no grasp on art at all.
What kind of backwards ass thinking is "I have to commit the same abuse in trying to protest".

You want to make America great? Improve America's ability to compete. That's all you can do.

posts.title: Los Angeles County sues Southern California Edison, alleging utility’s equipment sparked wildfire
top_comments: Does it make a difference? They'll just pay for the fines by CPUC approved rate hikes.

again. 

This time there appears to be footage as it started.

Same with the fires caused by PG&E.  Newsom screwed the pooch on that one.  California should not only own PG&E, they should make all utilities public entities - including cell companies.  T-Mobile was sued by CPUC for causing large wildfires because of brush around base stations knocking up against the wires and transformers. Just one more example.
They need to prohibit Edison from raising rates post-lawsuit, otherwise it's just going to be Edison customers footing the bill.
17 people died..and thousands of properties were destroyed. Fuck..

*The complaint alleges that witnesses, photos, and videos indicate the fire started directly under Edison transmission lines in Eaton Canyon.    “We are committed to seeking justice for the Altadena community and the taxpayers of Los Angeles County,” she said.*

Sounds like a repeat of the PG&E responsibility for most or many of the northern CA fires, some of which destroyed whole villages and cities.

everyone was ready to hunt down every homeless person and completely change the political landscape when the fire starter was unknown, but the moment we learned the Eaton fire came from a faulty powerline, that lets be real, they probably knew about, all ire just sort of disappeared. 

Utilities like these need to be government owned.

That utility and other companies should be held accountable for the damage they created only makes sense. The problem with suing them doesn't accomplish much. What will happen is they raise rates for their customers. The customer, not the business, will pay the fine, plus higher rates past when it's paid for.

This isn't the first time this has happened. Sure, they take a short-term hit, but they'll get that money back and then some. Maybe jail time for CEOs, managers, or the board of directors. But just fining them millions will only shift the burden to the customers/tax payers.
PG&E just happy they didn’t start another disaster
Alleged? There is video. However, the lawsuit will fail.
